intro: Potentilla thuringiaca var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to central and eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers in early summer, which are attractive to pollinators. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to cultivated landscapes.
